class.name: PIXI.Text

parameters.name: text
parameters.help: The copy that you would like the text to display

parameters.name: [style]
parameters.help: The style parameters

parameters.name: [style.font]
parameters.help: default 'bold 20px Arial' The style and size of the font

parameters.name: [style.fill='black']
parameters.help: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text e.g 'red', '#00FF00'

parameters.name: [style.align='left']
parameters.help: Alignment for multiline text ('left', 'center' or 'right'), does not affect single line text

parameters.name: [style.stroke]
parameters.help: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text stroke e.g 'blue', '#FCFF00'

parameters.name: [style.strokeThickness=0]
parameters.help: A number that represents the thickness of the stroke. Default is 0 (no stroke)

parameters.name: [style.wordWrap=false]
parameters.help: Indicates if word wrap should be used

parameters.name: [style.wordWrapWidth=100]
parameters.help: The width at which text will wrap, it needs wordWrap to be set to true

parameters.name: [style.dropShadow=false]
parameters.help: Set a drop shadow for the text

parameters.name: [style.dropShadowColor='#000000']
parameters.help: A fill style to be used on the dropshadow e.g 'red', '#00FF00'

parameters.name: [style.dropShadowAngle=Math.PI/4]
parameters.help: Set a angle of the drop shadow

parameters.name: [style.dropShadowDistance=5]
parameters.help: Set a distance of the drop shadow

class.help: A Text Object will create a line or multiple lines of text. To split a line you can use '\n' in your text string,\nor add a wordWrap property set to true and and wordWrapWidth property with a value in the style object.

public.name: addChild
public.help: Adds a child to the container.

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The DisplayObject to add to the container

public.name: addChildAt
public.help: Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to add

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to place the child in

public.name: click
public.help: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse's left button

public.name: destroy
public.help: Destroys this text object.

parameters.name: destroyBaseTexture
parameters.help: whether to destroy the base texture as well

public.name: fromFrame

returns.help: A new Sprite using a texture from the texture cache matching the frameId

public.help: \nHelper function that creates a sprite that will contain a texture from the TextureCache based on the frameId\nThe frame ids are created when a Texture packer file has been loaded

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.help: The frame Id of the texture in the cache

public.name: fromImage

returns.help: A new Sprite using a texture from the texture cache matching the image id

public.help: \nHelper function that creates a sprite that will contain a texture based on an image url\nIf the image is not in the texture cache it will be loaded

parameters.name: imageId
parameters.help: The image url of the texture

public.name: generateTexture

returns.help: a texture of the graphics object

public.help: Useful function that returns a texture of the displayObject object that can then be used to create sprites\nThis can be quite useful if your displayObject is static / complicated and needs to be reused multiple times.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.help: The resolution of the texture being generated

parameters.name: scaleMode
parameters.help: Should be one of the PIXI.scaleMode consts

parameters.name: renderer
parameters.help: The renderer used to generate the texture.

public.name: getBounds
public.help: Returns the bounds of the Sprite as a rectangle. The bounds calculation takes the worldTransform into account.

parameters.name: matrix
parameters.help: the transformation matrix of the sprite

public.name: getChildAt

returns.help: The child at the given index, if any.

public.help: Returns the child at the specified index

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to get the child from

public.name: getChildIndex

returns.help: The index position of the child display object to identify

public.help: Returns the index position of a child DisplayObject instance

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The DisplayObject instance to identify

public.name: getLocalBounds
public.help: Retrieves the non-global local bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

public.name: mousedown
public.help: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse's left button down over the sprite

public.name: mouseout
public.help: A callback that is used when the users mouse leaves the displayObject

public.name: mouseover
public.help: A callback that is used when the users mouse rolls over the displayObject

public.name: mouseup
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's left button that was over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's left button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: mouseupoutside
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's left button that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's left button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: removeChild
public.help: Removes a child from the container.

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The DisplayObject to remove

public.name: removeChildAt
public.help: Removes a child from the specified index position.

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to get the child from

public.name: removeChildren
public.help: Removes all children from this container that are within the begin and end indexes.

parameters.name: beginIndex
parameters.help: The beginning position. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.help: The ending position. Default value is size of the container.

public.name: removeStageReference
public.help: Removes the current stage reference from the container and all of its children.

public.name: rightclick
public.help: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse's right button

public.name: rightdown
public.help: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse's right button down over the sprite

public.name: rightup
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's right button that was over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired the mouse's right button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: rightupoutside
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's right button that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's right button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: setChildIndex
public.help: Changes the position of an existing child in the display object container

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child DisplayObject instance for which you want to change the index number

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The resulting index number for the child display object

public.name: setStageReference
public.help: Sets the containers Stage reference. This is the Stage that this object, and all of its children, is connected to.

parameters.name: stage
parameters.help: the stage that the container will have as its current stage reference

public.name: setStyle
public.help: Set the style of the text

parameters.name: [style]
parameters.help: The style parameters

parameters.name: [style.fill='black']
parameters.help: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text eg 'red', '#00FF00'

parameters.name: [style.align='left']
parameters.help: Alignment for multiline text ('left', 'center' or 'right'), does not affect single line text

parameters.name: [style.stroke='black']
parameters.help: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text stroke eg 'blue', '#FCFF00'

parameters.name: [style.strokeThickness=0]
parameters.help: A number that represents the thickness of the stroke. Default is 0 (no stroke)

parameters.name: [style.wordWrap=false]
parameters.help: Indicates if word wrap should be used

parameters.name: [style.wordWrapWidth=100]
parameters.help: The width at which text will wrap

parameters.name: [style.dropShadow=false]
parameters.help: Set a drop shadow for the text

parameters.name: [style.dropShadowColor='#000000']
parameters.help: A fill style to be used on the dropshadow e.g 'red', '#00FF00'

parameters.name: [style.dropShadowAngle=Math.PI/4]
parameters.help: Set a angle of the drop shadow

parameters.name: [style.dropShadowDistance=5]
parameters.help: Set a distance of the drop shadow

public.name: setText
public.help: Set the copy for the text object. To split a line you can use '\n'.

parameters.name: text
parameters.help: The copy that you would like the text to display

public.name: setTexture
public.help: Sets the texture of the sprite

parameters.name: texture
parameters.help: The PIXI texture that is displayed by the sprite

public.name: swapChildren
public.help: Swaps the position of 2 Display Objects within this container.

public.name: tap
public.help: A callback that is used when the users taps on the sprite with their finger\nbasically a touch version of click

public.name: toGlobal

returns.help: A point object representing the position of this object

public.help: Calculates the global position of the display object

parameters.name: position
parameters.help: The world origin to calculate from

public.name: toLocal

returns.help: A point object representing the position of this object

public.help: Calculates the local position of the display object relative to another point

parameters.name: position
parameters.help: The world origin to calculate from

parameters.name: [from]
parameters.help: The DisplayObject to calculate the global position from

public.name: touchend
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases a touch over the displayObject

public.name: touchendoutside
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the touch that was over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, The touch must have started over the sprite

public.name: touchstart
public.help: A callback that is used when the user touches over the displayObject

public.name: updateCache
public.help: Generates and updates the cached sprite for this object.

private.name: _renderCanvas
private.help: Renders the object using the Canvas renderer

private.name: _renderWebGL
private.help: Renders the object using the WebGL renderer

private.name: determineFontProperties
private.help: Calculates the ascent, descent and fontSize of a given fontStyle

private.name: updateText
private.help: Renders text and updates it when needed

private.name: updateTexture
private.help: Updates texture size based on canvas size

private.name: wordWrap
private.help: Applies newlines to a string to have it optimally fit into the horizontal\nbounds set by the Text object's wordWrapWidth property.

public.name: alpha
public.help: The opacity of the object.

public.name: anchor
public.help:
The anchor sets the origin point of the texture.
The default is 0,0 this means the texture's origin is the top left
Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered
Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right corner

public.name: blendMode
public.help: The blend mode to be applied to the sprite. Set to PIXI.blendModes.NORMAL to remove any blend mode.

public.name: buttonMode
public.help: This is used to indicate if the displayObject should display a mouse hand cursor on rollover

public.name: cacheAsBitmap
public.help: Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.\nThis basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.\nTo remove simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: canvas
public.help: The canvas element that everything is drawn to

public.name: children
public.help: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

public.name: context
public.help: The canvas 2d context that everything is drawn with

public.name: defaultCursor
public.help: This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true\n

public.name: filterArea
public.help: The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation\nrather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

public.name: filters
public.help: Sets the filters for the displayObject.\n* IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer.\nTo remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: height
public.help: The height of the Text, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: hitArea
public.help: This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.\nSetting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

public.name: interactive
public.help: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default

public.name: mask
public.help: Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.\nIn PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.\nTo remove a mask, set this property to null.

public.name: parent
public.help: [read-only] The display object container that contains this display object.

public.name: pivot
public.help: The pivot point of the displayObject that it rotates around

public.name: position
public.help: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: renderable
public.help: Can this object be rendered

public.name: resolution
public.help: The resolution of the canvas.

public.name: rotation
public.help: The rotation of the object in radians.

public.name: scale
public.help: The scale factor of the object.

public.name: shader
public.help: The shader that will be used to render the texture to the stage. Set to null to remove a current shader.

public.name: stage
public.help: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.

public.name: texture
public.help: The texture that the sprite is using

public.name: tint
public.help: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.

public.name: visible
public.help: The visibility of the object.

public.name: width
public.help: The width of the Text, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: worldAlpha
public.help: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject

public.name: worldVisible
public.help: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globally visible.

public.name: x
public.help: The position of the displayObject on the x axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: y
public.help: The position of the displayObject on the y axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.
